related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Conversation Summary for pieces-app/support #621

**Key Points**:

* PASimmons reported an issue where PiecesOS wouldn't run on their Apple Silicon Mac.
* mark-at-pieces suggested troubleshooting steps, including reinstalling with the appropriate build for Apple Silicon.
* PASimmons confirmed the problem was resolved after reinstalling.
* mark-at-pieces closed the conversation and linked to an ongoing announcement regarding service limitations on M1 Macs.

**Problems Identified**:

* PiecesOS wouldn't run on the user's Apple Silicon MacBook.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented**:

* mark-at-pieces proposed troubleshooting steps, including:
   * Killing related Processes
   * Providing support logs
   * Ensuring the correct architecture (Apple Silicon) was installed
* PASimmons reinstalled using the Apple Silicon version and the problem was resolved

**Current Status/Outcome**:

* Resolved. PiecesOS is running successfully for PASimmons on their M1 Mac.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Issue Summary of GitHub issue #613: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application):

**Key points raised:**

* The issue involves PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or not running at all.
* The error message indicates an issue with ensuring core dependencies in the desktop application.
* Users are facing this issue on both Windows and macOS platforms.
* Some users report success after the release of the 11.1.1 update, while others continue to experience problems.

**Problems identified:**

* Handshake errors due to self-signed certificates in the certificate chain.
* Missing systray icon for os_server.exe process.
* Inability of PFD to connect to PiecesOS.
* Issues related to OneDrive interfering with PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.1.
* Reinstall PiecesOS.
* For Windows users, try using the appInstaller build instead of the standard installer.
* Ensure your antivirus software isn't blocking PiecesOS.
* Remove the com.pieces.os folder within your OneDrive/Documents location if it's empty.
* Contact PiecesOS support for further assistance.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for some users after updating to version 11.1.1.
* Others, like JasonDWilson and RogierLegti, may require further investigation and support from PiecesOS.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue highlights the importance of keeping PiecesOS updated to the latest version.
* Users experiencing difficulties are encouraged to contact PiecesOS support for troubleshooting assistance.

**To conclude, while the 11.1.1 update appears to have resolved the issue for some users, further investigation and support are necessary for those with ongoing problems.**

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Issue Summary of GitHub issue #613: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application):

**Key points raised:**

* The issue involves PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or not running at all.
* The error message indicates an issue with ensuring core dependencies in the desktop application.
* Users are facing this issue on both Windows and macOS platforms.
* Some users report success after the release of the 11.1.1 update, while others continue to experience problems.

**Problems identified:**

* Handshake errors due to self-signed certificates in the certificate chain.
* Missing systray icon for os_server.exe process.
* Inability of PFD to connect to PiecesOS.
* Issues related to OneDrive interfering with PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.1.
* Reinstall PiecesOS.
* For Windows users, try using the appInstaller build instead of the standard installer.
* Ensure your antivirus software isn't blocking PiecesOS.
* Remove the com.pieces.os folder within your OneDrive/Documents location if it's empty.
* Contact PiecesOS support for further assistance.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for some users after updating to version 11.1.1.
* Others, like JasonDWilson and RogierLegti, may require further investigation and support from PiecesOS.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue highlights the importance of keeping PiecesOS updated to the latest version.
* Users experiencing difficulties are encouraged to contact PiecesOS support for troubleshooting assistance.

**To conclude, while the 11.1.1 update appears to have resolved the issue for some users, further investigation and support are necessary for those with ongoing problems.**

## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Freezing on Linux Mint

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `94tejas` reported the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The Pieces team identified a potential cause as a Flutter issue related to TextFields on specific versions of Linux Mint.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app freezes for some users on Linux Mint.
* The issue is related to a known Flutter bug.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* As a workaround, disabling the on-screen keyboard in accessibility settings was suggested.
* The Pieces team is working on a hotfix to address the issue permanently.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The workaround of disabling the virtual keyboard resolves the freezing issue for `94tejas`.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a long-term fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to certain versions of Linux Mint.
* The Pieces team provided helpful resources for the user, including existing issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** This issue is the most common and impactful, affecting both Windows and macOS users. Focus on identifying the root causes related to core dependencies, certificates, antivirus conflicts, and OneDrive.
**Improve communication around MacOS updates:** Provide clear instructions on installing the correct architecture version for Apple Silicon Macs to prevent launch issues after updates.
**Investigate and address Ollama model download failures:** This recurring issue requires further investigation to determine the cause and provide a permanent solution.
**Review and enhance error messaging:** Improve clarity around "ensuring core dependencies" errors to help users understand and troubleshoot the problem.
**Gather more detailed logs and system information:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system details when reporting issues to expedite troubleshooting.
**Develop a troubleshooting guide for common issues:** Create a publicly accessible guide addressing common problems like launch failures, update issues, and model download errors.
**Consider automated checks for common conflicts:** Explore implementing checks for known conflicts with antivirus software, OneDrive, and other applications during installation or launch.

**Monitor and address issues with new PiecesOS versions proactively:** Implement rigorous testing and monitoring for new releases to identify and address potential issues before they impact a large number of users.
